Articles.Content: Sounds interesting. I wonder how it will stack up science wise. Gravity was incredibly ground-breaking in that department, it will be interesting to see what film makers do next.

America kind of cheated, he only did a suborbital hop and Gagarin had already been in orbit...

Pretty good cast:

Matthew McConaughey, Jessica Chastain, Michael Caine, Anne Hathaway, Casey Affleck, Bill Irwin, Ellen Burstyn, John Lithgow, Wes Bentley, Mackenzie Foy, Timothee Chalamet, Topher Grace, David Oyelowo and Matt Damon.

Can you believe there's people who think Shepard was the first man to orbit the Earth?

Yeah, I know all about it. I also know that the vast majority thinks that Sally Ride was the first woman in space and have absolutely no idea about Tereshkova and Savitskaya, the first woman in space and the first woman on EVA.

I wonder how they will make the movie. I hope there will be cool exploration of an exoplanet in another solar system with unusual biology and geographical features. But I don't want too much alien cr*p like in Avatar.
I hope they keep it based on reality. The timeframe is obviously the very near future and interstellar travel is just science fiction.

I'm guessing the plotline is like this.

In 2037, NASA is in ruins from budget cuts, and has given up on spaceflight. Suddenly, a wormhole appears near earth, and with the urging of top scientists, NASA sends a manned expedition as a last hurrah before dying away. The fate of NASA now depends on the success of the crew, as they travel into the wormhole and into another star system. Stuff happens.
^^ pretty much what I had in mind.
